etymology.description: 毛 ‘hairy; fuzzy’ + 豆 ‘bean’ = hairy/fuzzy bean (immature soybean).
etymology.interpretation: Refers to immature soybeans still in their fuzzy pods; ‘hairy’ highlights the fine down on the pods.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃毛豆(我喜歡吃毛豆)。
饭馆端上一盘盐水毛豆(飯館端上一盤鹽水毛豆)。
examples.pinyin: Fànguǎn duān shàng yí pán yánshuǐ máodòu.
examples.english: The restaurant served a plate of salted edamame.

examples.chinese: 毛豆是未成熟的黄豆(毛豆是未成熟的黃豆)。
examples.pinyin: Máodòu shì wèi chéngshú de huángdòu.
